  826: 	 {{252,253,254,255},"0xfcfdfeff"},
  827: 	 {{252,253,254,255},"00000000000037477377377"},
  828: 	 {{16#12,16#34,16#56,16#78},"0x12345678"},
  829: 	 {{16#12,16#34,16#56,16#78},"0x12.0x345678"},
  830: 	 {{16#12,16#34,16#56,16#78},"0x12.0X34.0x5678"},
  831: 	 {{16#12,16#34,16#56,16#78},"0x12.0X34.0x56.0X78"},
  832: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"0"},
  833: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"00"},
  834: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"0.0"},
  835: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"00.00.00"},
  836: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"0.00.0.0"},
  837: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"0.0.000000000000.0"}],
  838:     V6Sloppy =
  839:         [{{16#a,16#b,16#c,16#0,16#0,16#d,16#e,16#f},"A:B:C::d:e:f"},
  840:          {{16#fe80,0,0,0,0,0,0,16#12},"fe80::12%XXXXXXX"}]
  841:         ++
  842:         [{{P,0,0,0,0,D2,(D1 bsl 8) bor D2,(D3 bsl 8) bor D4},
  843:           Q++erlang:integer_to_list(D2, 16)++":"++S}
  844:          || {{D1,D2,D3,D4},S} <- V4Reversable,
  845:             {P,Q} <-
  846:                 [{16#2001,"2001::"},{16#177,"177::"},{16#ff0,"Ff0::"}]],
  847:     V4Err =
  848: 	["0.256.0.1",
  849: 	 "1.2.3.4.5",
  850: 	 "256.255.65535",
  851: 	 "4294967296",
  852: 	 "0x100000000",
  853: 	 "040000000000",
  854: 	 "1.2.3.-4",
  855: 	 "1.2.-3.4",
  856: 	 "1.-2.3.4",
  857: 	 "-1.2.3.4",
  858: 	 "10.",
  859: 	 "172.16.",
  860: 	 "198.168.0.",
  861: 	 "127.0.0.1."],
  862:     V6Err =
  863: 	[":::",
  864: 	 "f:::2",
  865: 	 "::-1",
  866: 	 "::g",
  867: 	 "f:f11::10100:2",
  868: 	 "f:f11::01100:2",
  869: 	 "::17000",
  870: 	 "::01700",
  871: 	 "10000::",
  872: 	 "01000::",
  873: 	 "::8:7:6:5:4:3:2:1",
  874: 	 "8:7:6:5:4:3:2:1::",
  875: 	 "8:7:6:5:4::3:2:1",
  876: 	 "::1.2.3.4.5",
  877: 	 "::1.2.3.04",
  878: 	 "::1.256.3.4",
  879: 	 "::-5.4.3.2",
  880: 	 "::5.-4.3.2",
  881: 	 "::5.4.-3.2",
  882: 	 "::5.4.3.-2",
  883: 	 "::FFFF:1.2.3.4.5",
  884: 	 "::10.",
  885: 	 "::FFFF:172.16.",
  886: 	 "fe80::198.168.0.",
  887: 	 "fec0::fFfF:127.0.0.1."],
  888:     t_parse_address
  889:       (parse_ipv6_address,
  890:        false,
  891:        V6Reversable++V6Sloppy++V6Err++V4Err),
  892:     t_parse_address
  893:       (parse_ipv6strict_address,
  894:        true,
  895:        V6Reversable++V6Err++V4Err),
  896:     t_parse_address
  897:       (parse_ipv4_address,
  898:        false,
  899:        V4Reversable++V4Sloppy++V4Err++V6Err++[S || {_,S} <- V6Reversable]),
  900:     t_parse_address
  901:       (parse_ipv4strict_address,
  902:        true,
  903:        V4Reversable++V4Err++V6Err++[S || {_,S} <- V4Sloppy++V6Reversable]).
  904: 
  905: t_parse_address(Func, _Reversable, []) ->
  906:     io:format("~p done.~n", [Func]),
  907:     ok;
  908: t_parse_address(Func, Reversible, [{Addr,String}|L]) ->
  909:     io:format("~p = ~p.~n", [Addr,String]),
  910:     {ok,Addr} = inet:Func(String),
  911:     case Reversible of
  912:         true ->String = inet:ntoa(Addr);
  913:         false -> ok
  914:     end,
  915:     t_parse_address(Func, Reversible, L);
  916: t_parse_address(Func, Reversible, [String|L]) ->
  917:     io:format("~p.~n", [String]),
  918:     {error,einval} = inet:Func(String),
  919:     t_parse_address(Func, Reversible, L).
  920: 
  921: parse_strict_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  922:     {ok, {127,0,0,1}} =
  923: 	inet:parse_strict_address("127.0.0.1"),
  924:     {ok, {3089,3106,23603,50240,21952,50796,119,136}} =
  925: 	inet:parse_strict_address("c11:0c22:5c33:c440:55c0:c66c:77:0088"),
  926:     {ok, {3089,3106,23603,50240,0,0,119,136}} =
  927: 	inet:parse_strict_address("c11:0c22:5c33:c440::077:0088").
  928: 
  929: is_ip_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  930:     IPv4Addresses = [
  931:         {0, 0, 0, 0},
  932:         {255, 255, 255, 255}
  933:     ],
  934:     IPv6Addresses = [
  935:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  936:         {16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff}
  937:     ],
  938:     NonIPAddresses = [
  939:         foo,
  940:         "0.0.0.0",
  941:         {},
  942:         {0},
  943:         {0, 0},
  944:         {0, 0, 0},
  945:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  946:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  947:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  948:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  949:         {0, 0, 0, foo},
  950:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, foo},
  951:         {0, 0, 0, 256},
  952:         {0, 0, 256, 0},
  953:         {0, 256, 0, 0},
  954:         {256, 0, 0, 0},
  955:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 16#10000},
  956:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 16#10000, 0},
  957:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 16#10000, 0, 0},
  958:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 16#10000, 0, 0, 0},
  959:         {0, 0, 0, 16#10000, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  960:         {0, 0, 16#10000, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  961:         {0, 16#10000, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  962:         {16#10000, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  963:         {0, 0, 0, -1},
  964:         {0, 0, -1, 0},
  965:         {0, -1, 0, 0},
  966:         {-1, 0, 0, 0},
  967:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, -1},
  968:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, -1, 0},
  969:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, -1, 0, 0},
  970:         {0, 0, 0, 0, -1, 0, 0, 0},
  971:         {0, 0, 0, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  972:         {0, 0, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  973:         {0, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  974:         {-1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0}
  975:     ],
  976: 
  977:     true = lists:all(fun inet:is_ipv4_address/1, IPv4Addresses),
  978:     false = lists:any(fun inet:is_ipv4_address/1, IPv6Addresses ++ NonIPAddresses),
  979: 
  980:     true = lists:all(fun inet:is_ipv6_address/1, IPv6Addresses),
  981:     false = lists:any(fun inet:is_ipv6_address/1, IPv4Addresses ++ NonIPAddresses),
  982: 
  983:     true = lists:all(fun inet:is_ip_address/1, IPv6Addresses ++ IPv4Addresses),
  984:     false = lists:any(fun inet:is_ip_address/1, NonIPAddresses).
  985: 
  986: ipv4_mapped_ipv6_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  987:     {D1,D2,D3,D4} = IPv4Address =
  988:         {rand:uniform(256) - 1,
  989:          rand:uniform(256) - 1,
  990:          rand:uniform(256) - 1,
  991:          rand:uniform(256) - 1},
  992:     E7 = (D1 bsl 8) bor D2,
  993:     E8 = (D3 bsl 8) bor D4,
  994:     io:format("IPv4Address: ~p.~n", [IPv4Address]),
  995:     {0,0,0,0,0,65535,E7,E8} = inet:ipv4_mapped_ipv6_address(IPv4Address),
  996:     IPv6Address =
  997:         {rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
  998:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
  999:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
 1000:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
 1001:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
 1002:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1, E7, E8},
 1003:     IPv4Address = inet:ipv4_mapped_ipv6_address(IPv6Address),
 1004:     ok.
 1005: 
 1006: 
 1007: ntoa(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1008:     M8 = 1 bsl 8,
 1009:     M16 = 1 bsl 16,
 1010:     V4Xs = rand_tuple(4, M8),
 1011:     V6Xs = rand_tuple(4, M16),
 1012:     ntoa(
 1013:       [{A, B, C, D} ||
 1014:           A <- [0, element(1, V4Xs), M8-1, -1, 256],
 1015:           B <- [0, element(2, V4Xs), M8-1, -1, 256],
 1016:           C <- [0, element(3, V4Xs), M8-1, -1, 256],
 1017:           D <- [0, element(4, V4Xs), M8-1, -1, 256]], M8-1),
 1018:     ntoa(
 1019:       [{E, F, G, H, G, G, E, F} ||
 1020:           E <- [0, element(1, V6Xs), M16-1, -1, M16],
 1021:           F <- [0, element(2, V6Xs), M16-1, -1, M16],
 1022:           G <- [0, element(3, V6Xs), M16-1, -1, M16],
 1023:           H <- [0, element(4, V6Xs), M16-1, -1, M16]], M16-1).
 1024: 
 1025: ntoa([A | As], Max) ->
 1026:     case
 1027:         lists:all(
 1028:           fun (X) when 0 =< X, X =< Max -> true;
 1029:               (_) -> false
 1030:           end, tuple_to_list(A))
 1031:     of
 1032:         true ->
 1033:             S = inet:ntoa(A),
 1034:             {ok, A} = inet:parse_address(S);
 1035:         false ->
 1036:             {error, einval} = inet:ntoa(A)
 1037:     end,
 1038:     ntoa(As, Max);
 1039: ntoa([], _Max) ->
 1040:     ok.
 1041: 
 1042: rand_tuple(N, M) ->
 1043:     rand_tuple(N, M, []).
 1044: %%
 1045: rand_tuple(0, _M, Acc) ->
 1046:     list_to_tuple(Acc);
 1047: rand_tuple(N, M, Acc) ->
 1048:     rand_tuple(N - 1, M, [rand:uniform(M) - 1 | Acc]).
 1049: 
 1050: 
 1051: t_gethostnative(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1052:     %% this will result in 26 bytes sent which causes problem in Windows
 1053:     %% if the port-program has not assured stdin to be read in BINARY mode
 1054:     %% OTP-2555
 1055:     case inet_gethost_native:gethostbyname(
 1056: 	   "a23456789012345678901234") of
 1057: 	{error,notfound} ->
 1058: 	    ok;
 1059: 	{error,no_data} ->
 1060: 	    ok;
 1061: 	{error,try_again} ->
 1062: 	    ok
 1063:     end.
 1064: 
 1065: %% Check that the emulator survives crashes in gethost_native.
 1066: gethostnative_parallell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1067:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1068:     {ok,_} = inet:gethostbyname(Hostname),
 1069:     case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1070: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1071: 	    do_gethostnative_parallell();
 1072: 	_ ->
 1073: 	    {skipped, "Not running native gethostbyname"}
 1074:     end.
 1075: 
 1076: do_gethostnative_parallell() ->
 1077:     {ok,Peer,Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1078:     ok = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, parallell_gethost, []),
 1079:     receive after 10000 -> ok end,
 1080:     pong = net_adm:ping(Node),
 1081:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1082:     ok.
 1083: 
 1084: parallell_gethost() ->
 1085:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1086:     process_flag(trap_exit,true),
 1087:     parallell_gethost_loop(10, Hostname).
 1088: 
 1089: parallell_gethost_loop(0, _) -> ok;
 1090: parallell_gethost_loop(N, Hostname) ->
 1091:     case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1092: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1093: 	    true = exit(Pid,kill);
 1094: 	_ ->
 1095: 	    ok
 1096:     end,
 1097: 
 1098:     L = spawn_gethosters(Hostname, 10),
 1099:     release_gethosters(L),
 1100:     collect_gethosters(10),
 1101:     parallell_gethost_loop(N-1, Hostname).
 1102: 
 1103: spawn_gethosters(_, 0) ->
 1104:     [];
 1105: spawn_gethosters(Hostname, N) ->
 1106:     Collector = self(),
 1107:     [spawn(fun() ->
 1108: 		   receive 
 1109: 		       go ->
 1110: 			   case (catch inet:gethostbyname(Hostname)) of
 1111: 			       {ok,_} ->
 1112: 				   Collector ! ok;
 1113: 			       Else ->
 1114: 				   Collector ! {error,Else}
 1115: 			   end
 1116: 		   end 
 1117: 	   end) | 
 1118:      spawn_gethosters(Hostname, N-1)].
 1119: 
 1120: release_gethosters([]) ->
 1121:     ok;
 1122: release_gethosters([H|T]) ->
 1123:     H ! go,
 1124:     release_gethosters(T).
 1125: 
 1126: collect_gethosters(0) ->
 1127:     ok;
 1128: collect_gethosters(N) ->
 1129:     receive
 1130: 	ok ->
 1131: 	    collect_gethosters(N-1);
 1132: 	Else ->
 1133: 	    {failed, {unexpected, Else}}
 1134:     after 2000 ->
 1135: 	    {failed, {missing, N}}
 1136:     end.
 1137: 
 1138: kill_gethost() ->
 1139:     kill_gethost(20).
 1140: 
 1141: kill_gethost(0) ->
 1142:     ok;
 1143: kill_gethost(N) ->
 1144:     put(kill_gethost_n,N),
 1145:     Pid = wait_for_gethost(10),
 1146:     true = exit(Pid,kill),
 1147:     wait_for_dead_gethost(10),
 1148:     kill_gethost(N-1).
 1149: 
 1150: wait_for_dead_gethost(0) ->
 1151:     exit({not_dead,inet_gethost_native});
 1152: wait_for_dead_gethost(N) ->
 1153:     case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1154: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1155: 	    receive after 1000 ->
 1156: 			    ok
 1157: 		    end,
 1158: 	    wait_for_dead_gethost(N-1);
 1159: 	undefined ->
 1160: 	    ok
 1161:     end.
 1162: 
 1163: wait_for_gethost(0) ->
 1164:     exit(gethost_not_found);
 1165: wait_for_gethost(N) ->
 1166:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1167:     case (catch inet:gethostbyname(Hostname)) of
 1168: 	{ok,_} ->
 1169: 	    ok;
 1170: 	Otherwise ->
 1171: 	    %% This is what I call an exit tuple :)
 1172: 	    exit({inet,gethostbyname, returned, Otherwise, 'when',
 1173: 		  'N','=',N,'and','hostname','=',Hostname,'and',
 1174: 		  kill_gethost_n,'=',get(kill_gethost_n)})
 1175:     end,
 1176:     case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1177: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1178: 	    Pid;
 1179: 	_ ->
 1180: 	    receive
 1181: 	    after 1000 ->
 1182: 		    ok
 1183: 	    end,
 1184: 	    wait_for_gethost(N-1)
 1185:     end.
 1186: 
 1187: %% Check that the resolver handles a CNAME loop.
 1188: cname_loop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1189:     %% getbyname (hostent_by_domain)
 1190:     ok = inet_db:add_rr("mydomain.com", in, ?S_CNAME, ttl, "mydomain.com"),
 1191:     {error,nxdomain} = inet_db:getbyname("mydomain.com", ?S_A),
 1192:     ok = inet_db:del_rr("mydomain.com", in, ?S_CNAME, "mydomain.com"),
 1193:     %% res_hostent_by_domain
 1194:     RR = #dns_rr{domain = "mydomain.com",
 1195: 		 class = in,
 1196: 		 type = ?S_CNAME,
 1197: 		 data = "mydomain.com"},
 1198:     Rec = #dns_rec{anlist = [RR]},
 1199:     {error,nxdomain} = inet_db:res_hostent_by_domain("mydomain.com", ?S_A, Rec),
 1200:     ok.
 1201: 
 1202: 
 1203: %% Test that hosts file gets reloaded correctly in case when it
 1204: % was missing during initial startup
 1205: missing_hosts_reload(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1206:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1207:     HostsFile = filename:join(RootDir, atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ ".hosts"),
 1208:     InetRc = filename:join(RootDir, "inetrc"),
 1209:     ok = file:write_file(InetRc, "{hosts_file, \"" ++ HostsFile ++ "\"}.\n"),
 1210:     {error, enoent} = file:read_file_info(HostsFile),
 1211:     % start a node
 1212:     {ok, Peer, TestNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-kernel", "inetrc", "\"" ++ InetRc ++ "\""]),
 1213:     % ensure it has our RC
 1214:     Rc = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, get_rc, []),
 1215:     {hosts_file, HostsFile} = lists:keyfind(hosts_file, 1, Rc),
 1216:     % ensure it does not resolve
 1217:     {error, nxdomain} = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_hosts, gethostbyname, ["somehost"]),
 1218:     % write hosts file
 1219:     ok = file:write_file(HostsFile, "1.2.3.4 somehost"),
 1220:     % wait for cached timestamp to expire
 1221:     timer:sleep(?RES_FILE_UPDATE_TM * 1000 + 100),
 1222:     % ensure it DOES resolve
 1223:     {ok,{hostent,"somehost",[],inet,4,[{1,2,3,4}]}} =
 1224:         rpc:call(TestNode, inet_hosts, gethostbyname, ["somehost"]),
 1225:     % cleanup
 1226:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1227: 
 1228: 
 1229: %% The /etc/hosts file format and limitations is quite undocumented.
 1230: %%
 1231: %% Our implementation of the hosts file resolver tries to
 1232: %% do the right thing.  Here is an attempt to define "the right thing",
 1233: %% and this test case tries to check most of these rules:
 1234: %%
 1235: %% * A hosts file consists of entries with one IP address,
 1236: %%   and a list of host names.  The IP address is IPv4 or IPv6.
 1237: %%   The first host name is the primary host name
 1238: %%   and the others are aliases.
 1239: %%
 1240: %% * A lookup for an IP address should return one #hostent{} record
 1241: %%   with the one IP address from the query, and the host names
 1242: %%   from all entries with the same IP address concatenated.
 1243: %%   The first host name from the first hosts file entry
 1244: %%   with the requested IP address will be the primary host name
 1245: %%   and all others are aliases.  All host names are returned
 1246: %%   as in the hosts file entries i.e character case is preserved.
 1247: %%
 1248: %% * A lookup for a host name is character case insensitive.
 1249: %%
 1250: %% * A lookup for a host name should return one #hostent{} record
 1251: %%   with the host name list from the first hosts file entry
 1252: %%   with an IP address of the requested address family
 1253: %%   that has a matching host name, as it is in the hosts file
 1254: %%   i.e character case is preserved.  The IP addresses in the
 1255: %%   returned #hostent{} record should be the first from the
 1256: %%   same matching hosts file entry, followed by all others
 1257: %%   for which there is a matching host name and address family.
 1258: %%   There should be no duplicates among the returned IP addresses.
 1259: %%
 1260: %% * These rules are of the opinion that if duplicate host names
 1261: %%   with the same character casing occurs for the same IP
 1262: %%   address, it is a configuration error, so it is not tested for
 1263: %%   and there is no preferred behaviour.
 1264: hosts_file_quirks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1265:     Records = [R1, R2, R3, R4, R5] =
 1266:         [#hostent{
 1267:             h_name = h_ex(Name),
 1268:             h_aliases = [h_ex(Alias) || Alias <- Aliases],
 1269:             h_addrtype = Fam,
 1270:             h_length =
 1271:                 case Fam of
 1272:                     inet -> 4;
 1273:                     inet6 -> 16
 1274:                 end,
 1275:             h_addr_list =
 1276:                 [case Fam of
 1277:                      inet -> inet_ex(N);
 1278:                      inet6 -> inet6_ex(N)
 1279:                  end]}
 1280:          || {{Fam,N}, Name, Aliases} <-
 1281:                 [{{inet,1}, "a", ["B"]},
 1282:                  {{inet,2}, "D", []},
 1283:                  {{inet6,3}, "A", ["c"]},
 1284:                  {{inet,1}, "c", []},
 1285:                  {{inet,5}, "A", []}]],
 1286:     true = R1#hostent.h_addr_list =:= R4#hostent.h_addr_list,
 1287:     R14 =
 1288:         R1#hostent{
 1289:           h_aliases =
 1290:               R1#hostent.h_aliases ++
 1291:               [R4#hostent.h_name | R4#hostent.h_aliases]},
 1292:     R145 =
 1293:         R14#hostent{
 1294:           h_addr_list =
 1295:               R1#hostent.h_addr_list ++ R5#hostent.h_addr_list},
 1296:     %%
 1297:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1298:     HostsFile = filename:join(RootDir, atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "-quirks.hosts"),
 1299:     InetRc = filename:join(RootDir, "quirks.inetrc"),
 1300:     ok = file:write_file(HostsFile, hostents_to_list(Records)),
 1301:     ok = file:write_file(InetRc, "{hosts_file, \"" ++ HostsFile ++ "\"}.\n"),
 1302:     %%
 1303:     %% start a node
 1304:     {ok, Peer, TestNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-kernel", "inetrc", "\"" ++ InetRc ++ "\""]),
 1305:     %% ensure it has our RC
 1306:     Rc = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, get_rc, []),
 1307:     {hosts_file, HostsFile} = lists:keyfind(hosts_file, 1, Rc),
 1308:     false = lists:keyfind(host, 1, Rc),
 1309:     %%
 1310:     %% check entries
 1311:     io:format("Check hosts file contents~n", []),
 1312:     V1 =
 1313:       [{R14, inet_ex(1)},
 1314:        {R2, inet_ex(2)},
 1315:        {R3, inet6_ex(3)},
 1316:        {R5, inet_ex(5)},
 1317:        {R145, h_ex("a"), inet},
 1318:        {R14, h_ex("b"), inet},
 1319:        {R14, h_ex("c"), inet},
 1320:        {R2, h_ex("d"), inet},
 1321:        {R3, h_ex("a"), inet6},
 1322:        {R3, h_ex("c"), inet6}
 1323:       ],
 1324:     hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, V1),
 1325:     %%
 1326:     %% test add and del
 1327:     A1 = inet_ex(1),
 1328:     Hs1 = [h_ex("a"), h_ex("B")],
 1329:     ok = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, add_host, [A1, Hs1]),
 1330:     io:format("Check after add host~n", []),
 1331:     hosts_file_quirks_verify(
 1332:       TestNode,
 1333:       [{R1, A1},
 1334:        {R2, inet_ex(2)},
 1335:        {R3, inet6_ex(3)},
 1336:        {R5, inet_ex(5)},
 1337:        {R1, h_ex("a"), inet},
 1338:        {R1, h_ex("b"), inet},
 1339:        {R14, h_ex("c"), inet},
 1340:        {R2, h_ex("d"), inet},
 1341:        {R3, h_ex("a"), inet6},
 1342:        {R3, h_ex("c"), inet6}
 1343:       ]),
 1344:     {host, A1, Hs1} =
 1345:         lists:keyfind(host, 1, rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, get_rc, [])),
 1346:     ok = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, del_host, [inet_ex(1)]),
 1347:     io:format("Check after del host~n", []),
 1348:     hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, V1),
 1349:     %%
 1350:     %% cleanup
 1351:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1352: 
 1353: hosts_file_quirks_verify(_TestNode, Vs) ->
 1354:     hosts_file_quirks_verify(_TestNode, Vs, true).
 1355: %%
 1356: hosts_file_quirks_verify(_TestNode, [], Ok) ->
 1357:     case Ok of
 1358:         true -> ok;
 1359:         false -> error(verify_failed)
 1360:     end;
 1361: hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, [V | Vs], Ok) ->
 1362:     case
 1363:         case V of
 1364:             {R, Addr} ->
 1365:                 {R, rpc:call(TestNode, inet_hosts, gethostbyaddr, [Addr])};
 1366:             {R, Host, Fam} ->
 1367:                 {R, rpc:call(TestNode, inet_hosts, gethostbyname, [Host, Fam])}
 1368:         end
 1369:     of
 1370:         {nxdomain, {error, nxdomain}} ->
 1371:             hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, Vs, Ok);
 1372:         {_R_1, {error, nxdomain}} ->
 1373:             io:format("Verify failed ~p: nxdomain~n", [V]),
 1374:             hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, Vs, false);
 1375:         {R_1, {ok, R_1}} ->
 1376:             hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, Vs, Ok);
 1377:         {_R_1, {ok, R_2}} ->
 1378:             io:format("Verify failed ~p: ~p~n", [V, R_2]),
 1379:             hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, Vs, false)
 1380:     end.
 1381: 
 1382: %% Expand entry
 1383: h_ex(H) -> H ++ ".example.com".
 1384: inet_ex(N) -> {127,17,17,N}.
 1385: inet6_ex(N) -> {0,0,0,0,17,17,17,N}.
 1386: 
 1387: hostents_to_list([]) -> [];
 1388: hostents_to_list([R | Rs]) ->
 1389:     #hostent{
 1390:        h_name = Name,
 1391:        h_aliases = Aliases,
 1392:        h_addr_list = [IP]} = R,
 1393:     [inet:ntoa(IP), $\t,
 1394:      lists:join($\s, [Name | Aliases]), $\r, $\n
 1395:      | hostents_to_list(Rs)].
 1396: 
 1397: 
 1398: %% These must be run in the whole suite since they need
 1399: %% the host list and require inet_gethost_native to be started.
 1400: %%
 1401: -record(gethostnative_control, {control_seq,
 1402: 				control_interval = 100,
 1403: 				lookup_delay     = 10,
 1404: 				lookup_count     = 300,
 1405: 				lookup_processes = 20}).
 1406: 
 1407: gethostnative_soft_restart() -> required(hosts).
 1408: 
 1409: %% Check that no name lookups fails during soft restart
 1410: %% of inet_gethost_native.
 1411: gethostnative_soft_restart(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1412:     Opts  = gethostnative_adjusted_opts(Config,
 1413:                                         [soft_restart]),
 1414:     gethostnative_control(Config, Opts).
 1415: 
 1416: gethostnative_debug_level() -> required(hosts).
 1417: 
 1418: %% Check that no name lookups fails during debug level change
 1419: %% of inet_gethost_native.
 1420: gethostnative_debug_level(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1421:     Opts  = gethostnative_adjusted_opts(Config,
 1422:                                         [{debug_level, 1},
 1423:                                          {debug_level, 0}]),
 1424:     gethostnative_control(Config, Opts).
 1425: 
 1426: gethostnative_adjusted_opts(Config, CtrlSeq) ->
 1427:     Factor = ?config(kernel_factor, Config),
 1428:     gethostnative_adjusted_opts2(Factor, CtrlSeq).
 1429: 
 1430: gethostnative_adjusted_opts2(1, CtrlSeq) ->
 1431:     #gethostnative_control{control_seq = CtrlSeq};
 1432: gethostnative_adjusted_opts2(F, CtrlSeq) ->
 1433:     Opts = #gethostnative_control{control_seq = CtrlSeq},
 1434:     gethostnative_adjusted_opts3(F, Opts).
 1435: 
 1436: gethostnative_adjusted_opts3(
 1437:   F,
 1438:   #gethostnative_control{lookup_count     = Cnt,
 1439:                          lookup_processes = NProc} = Opts) ->
 1440:     Adjust = fun(X) ->
 1441:                      if
 1442:                          F > 10 ->
 1443:                              X div 4;
 1444:                          F > 5 ->
 1445:                              X div 3;
 1446:                          F > 2 -> 
 1447:                              (2 * X) div 3;
 1448:                          true ->
 1449:                              X
 1450:                      end
 1451:              end,
 1452:     Opts#gethostnative_control{lookup_count     = Adjust(Cnt),
 1453:                                lookup_processes = Adjust(NProc)}.
 1454: 
 1455: 
 1456: gethostnative_control(Config, Opts) ->
 1457:     case inet_db:res_option(lookup) of
 1458: 	[native] ->
 1459: 	    case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1460: 		Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1461: 		    gethostnative_control_1(Config, Opts);
 1462: 		_ ->
 1463: 		    {skipped, "Not running native gethostbyname"}
 1464: 	    end;
 1465: 	_ ->
 1466: 	    {skipped, "Native not only lookup method"}
 1467:     end.
 1468: 
 1469: gethostnative_control_1(
 1470:   Config,
 1471:   #gethostnative_control{control_seq      = Seq,
 1472:                          control_interval = Interval,
 1473:                          lookup_delay     = Delay,
 1474:                          lookup_count     = Cnt,
 1475:                          lookup_processes = N}) ->
 1476:     ?P("gethostnative control -> begin with"
 1477:        "~n      Ctrl Seq:      ~p"
 1478:        "~n      Ctrl interval: ~p"
 1479:        "~n      Lookup delay:  ~p"
 1480:        "~n      Lookup count:  ~p"
 1481:        "~n      Lookup procs:  ~p", [Seq, Interval, Delay, Cnt, N]),
 1482:     {ok, Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1483:     {ok, _}        = inet:gethostbyname(Hostname),
 1484:     Hosts          =
 1485:         [Hostname|[H || {_,H} <- get_hosts(Config)]
 1486:          ++[H++D || H <- ["www.","www1.","www2.",""],
 1487:         	    D <- ["erlang.org","erlang.se"]]
 1488:          ++[H++"cslab.ericsson.net" || H <- ["morgoth.","hades.","styx."]]],
 1489:     ?P("ctrl-1: Hosts: "
 1490:        "~n   ~p", [Hosts]),
 1491:     %% Spawn some processes to do parallel lookups while
 1492:     %% I repeatedly do inet_gethost_native:control/1.
 1493:     TrapExit = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1494:     gethostnative_control_2([undefined], Interval, Delay, Cnt, N, Hosts),
 1495:     erlang:display(first_intermission),
 1496:     ?P("ctrl-1: First intermission: "
 1497:        "~n   Now starting control sequence ~p", [Seq]),
 1498:     gethostnative_control_2(Seq, Interval, Delay, Cnt, N, Hosts),
 1499:     erlang:display(second_intermission),
 1500:     ?P("ctrl-1: Second intermission: "
 1501:        "~n   Now stopping control sequence ~p", [Seq]),
 1502:     gethostnative_control_2([undefined], Interval, Delay, Cnt, N, Hosts),
 1503:     true = process_flag(trap_exit, TrapExit),
 1504:     ?P("control-1: done"),
 1505:     ok.
 1506: 
 1507: gethostnative_control_2(Seq, Interval, Delay, Cnt, N, Hosts) ->
 1508:     Tag       = make_ref(),
 1509:     Parent    = self(),
 1510:     Lookup    = fun() ->
 1511:                         ?P("lookuper starting"),
 1512:                         lookup_loop(Hosts, Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt, Hosts) 
 1513:                 end,
 1514:     Lookupers = [spawn_link(Lookup) || _ <- lists:seq(1, N)],
 1515:     control_loop(Seq, Interval, Tag, Lookupers, Seq),
 1516:     gethostnative_control_3(Tag, ok).
 1517: 
 1518: gethostnative_control_3(Tag, Reason) ->
 1519:     receive
 1520: 	{Tag, Lookuper, Error} ->
 1521:             ?P("control-3: received lookup error from ~p: ~p",
 1522:                [Lookuper, Error]),
 1523: 	    gethostnative_control_3(Tag, Error)
 1524:     after 0 ->
 1525:             ?P("control-3: no (more) lookup errors"),
 1526: 	    Reason
 1527:     end.
 1528: 
 1529: control_loop([], _Interval, _Tag, [], _Seq) ->
 1530:     ok;
 1531: control_loop([], Interval, Tag, Lookupers, Seq) ->
 1532:     control_loop(Seq, Interval, Tag, Lookupers, Seq);
 1533: control_loop([Op|Ops], Interval, Tag, Lookupers, Seq) ->
 1534:     control_loop(Ops, Interval, Tag, 
 1535: 		 control_loop_1(Op, Interval, Tag, Lookupers),
 1536: 		 Seq).
 1537: 
 1538: control_loop_1(Op, Interval, Tag, Lookupers) ->
 1539:     ?P("ctrl-loop-1: await lookuper exit"),
 1540:     receive
 1541:         {'EXIT', _Pid, {timetrap_timeout, _, _}} ->
 1542:             ?P("ctrl-loop-1: "
 1543:                "timetrap timeout while ~w lookupers remaining: "
 1544:                "~n   Op:       ~p"
 1545:                "~n   Interval: ~p"
 1546:                "~n   Tag:      ~p",
 1547:                [length(Lookupers), Op, Interval, Tag]),
 1548:             if
 1549:                 (Op =/= undefined) ->
 1550:                     exit({timetrap, {Op, Tag, length(Lookupers)}});
 1551:                 true ->
 1552:                     exit({timetrap, {Tag, length(Lookupers)}})
 1553:             end;
 1554: 
 1555: 	{'EXIT', Pid, Reason} ->
 1556: 	    case Reason of
 1557: 		Tag -> % Done
 1558:                     ?P("ctrl-loop-1: "
 1559:                        "received expected exit from lookuper ~p", [Pid]),
 1560: 		    control_loop_1
 1561: 		      (Op, Interval, Tag,
 1562: 		       lists:delete(Pid, Lookupers));
 1563: 		_ ->
 1564:                     ?P("ctrl-loop-1: "
 1565:                        "received unexpected exit from ~p: "
 1566:                        "~n   ~p", [Pid, Reason]),
 1567: 		    ct:fail(?F("Unexpected exit from ~p", [Pid]))
 1568: 	    end
 1569: 
 1570:     after Interval ->
 1571:             ?P("ctrl-loop-1: "
 1572:                "timeout => (maybe) attempt control ~p when"
 1573:                "~n   Lookupers: ~p", [Op, Lookupers]),
 1574: 	    if Op =/= undefined ->
 1575: 		    ok = inet_gethost_native:control(Op);
 1576: 	       true ->
 1577: 		    ok
 1578: 	    end,
 1579: 	    Lookupers
 1580:     end.
 1581: 
 1582: lookup_loop(_, _Delay, Tag, _Parent,  0, _Hosts) ->
 1583:     ?P("lookup-loop: done with ~p", [Tag]),
 1584:     exit(Tag);
 1585: lookup_loop([], Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt, Hosts) ->
 1586:     ?P("lookup-loop: begin lookup (~p) again when count = ~p", [Tag, Cnt]),
 1587:     lookup_loop(Hosts, Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt, Hosts);
 1588: lookup_loop([H|Hs], Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt, Hosts) ->
 1589:     ?P("lookup-loop: try lookup (~p, ~p) ~p", [Tag, Cnt, H]),
 1590:     case inet:gethostbyname(H) of
 1591: 	{ok, _Hent} ->
 1592:             ?P("lookup-loop: lookup => found"),
 1593:             ok;
 1594: 	{error, nxdomain} ->
 1595:             ?P("lookup-loop: lookup => nxdomain"),
 1596:             ok;
 1597: 	Error ->
 1598: 	    ?P("loopkup-loop: lookup => error for ~p: ~p", [H, Error]),
 1599: 	    Parent ! {Tag, self(), Error}
 1600:     end,
 1601:     receive
 1602:     after rand:uniform(Delay) ->
 1603: 	    lookup_loop(Hs, Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt-1, Hosts) 
 1604:     end.
 1605: 
 1606: 
 1607: 
 1608: %% Test lookup with erroneously configured lookup option (OTP-12133).
 1609: lookup_bad_search_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1610:     %% Manipulation of resolver config is done in init_per_testcase
 1611:     %% and end_per_testcase to ensure cleanup.
 1612:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1613:     {ok,_Hent} = inet:gethostbyname(Hostname), % Will hang loop for this bug
 1614:     ok.
 1615: 
 1616: 
 1617: 
 1618: %% Tests basic functionality of getiflist, getif, and ifget.
 1619: getif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1620:     case os:type() of
 1621: 	{unix,Osname} ->
 1622: 	    do_getif(Osname, default),
 1623:             do_getif(Osname, inet),
 1624:             do_getif(Osname, socket);
 1625: 	{_,_} ->
 1626: 	    {skip,"inet:getif/0 probably not supported"}
 1627:     end.
 1628: 
 1629: inet_getiflist(default) ->
 1630:     inet:getiflist();
 1631: inet_getiflist(Backend) ->
 1632:     Func = getiflist,
 1633:     Fun  = fun() -> inet:Func([{inet_backend, Backend}]) end,
 1634:     backend_conditional_run(Backend, Func, Fun).
 1635: 
 1636: 
 1637: backend_conditional_run(default = Backend, Func, Fun)
 1638:   when is_atom(Func) andalso
 1639:        is_function(Fun, 0) ->
 1640:        io:format("try '~w' ~w~n", [Backend, Func]),
 1641:        Fun();
 1642: backend_conditional_run(Backend, Func, Fun)
 1643:   when ((Backend =:= inet) orelse (Backend =:= socket)) andalso
 1644:        is_atom(Func) andalso
 1645:        is_function(Fun, 0) ->
 1646:     try is_supported_backend(Backend) of
 1647:         true ->
 1648:             io:format("try '~w' ~w~n", [Backend, Func]),
 1649:             Fun();            
 1650:         false ->
 1651:             io:format("skip '~w' ~w: not supported~n", [Backend, Func]),
 1652:             throw({skip, {Func, Backend, notsup}})
 1653:     catch
 1654:         C:E:S ->
 1655:             %% Assume its because we run in a 'noesock' (or similar) system...
 1656:             io:format("skipping ~p: "
 1657:                       "~n   (Error) Class: ~p"
 1658:                       "~n   Error:         ~p"
 1659:                       "~n   Stack:         ~p"
 1660:                       "~n", [Backend, C, E, S]),
 1661:             throw({skip, {Func, Backend, C, E}})
 1662:     end.            
 1663: 
 1664: 
 1665: inet_ifget(default, Name, Opts) ->
 1666:     inet:ifget(Name, Opts);
 1667: inet_ifget(Backend, Name, Opts) ->
 1668:     Func = ifget,
 1669:     Fun  = fun() -> inet:Func(Name, [{inet_backend, Backend}|Opts]) end,
 1670:     backend_conditional_run(Backend, Func, Fun).
 1671: 
 1672: inet_getif(default) ->
 1673:     inet:getif();
 1674: inet_getif(Backend) ->
 1675:     Func = getif,
 1676:     Fun  = fun() -> inet:Func([{inet_backend, Backend}]) end,
 1677:     backend_conditional_run(Backend, Func, Fun).
 1678:     
 1679: 
 1680: do_getif(OsName, Backend) ->
 1681:     io:format("~w(~w) -> entry with"
 1682:               "~n   OsName:  ~p"
 1683:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, OsName]),
 1684:     try do_getif2(OsName, Backend) of
 1685:         ok ->
 1686:             io:format("~w(~w) -> success~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend]),
 1687:             ok
 1688:     catch
 1689:         throw:{skip, Reason} ->
 1690:             io:format("~w(~w) -> skipping: "
 1691:                       "~n   ~p"
 1692:                       "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Reason]),
 1693:             ok
 1694:     end.
 1695: 
 1696: do_getif2(OsName, Backend) ->
 1697:     io:format("~w(~w) -> entry with"
 1698:               "~n   OsName:  ~p"
 1699:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, OsName]),
 1700: 
 1701:     %% For this to work with the 'socket' backend, we need to verify 
 1702:     {ok, Hostname}   = inet:gethostname(),
 1703:     io:format("~w(~w) -> "
 1704:               "~n   Hostname: ~p"
 1705:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Hostname]),
 1706:     {ok, Address}    = inet:getaddr(Hostname,    inet),
 1707:     io:format("~w(~w) -> "
 1708:               "~n   Address: ~p"
 1709:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Address]),
 1710:     {ok, Loopback}   = inet:getaddr("localhost", inet),
 1711:     io:format("~w(~w) -> "
 1712:               "~n   Loopback: ~p"
 1713:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Loopback]),
 1714:     {ok, Interfaces} = inet_getiflist(Backend),
 1715:     io:format("~w(~w) -> "
 1716:               "~n   Interfaces: ~p"
 1717:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Interfaces]),
 1718:     HWAs =
 1719:         lists:sort(
 1720:           lists:foldl(
 1721:             fun (I, Acc) ->
 1722:                     case inet_ifget(Backend, I, [hwaddr]) of
 1723:                         {ok,[{hwaddr,A}]} -> [A|Acc];
 1724:                         {ok,[]} -> Acc
 1725:                     end
 1726:             end, [], Interfaces)),
 1727:     io:format("~w(~w) -> "
 1728:               "~n   HW Addrs:"
 1729:               "~n      ~p"
 1730:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, HWAs]),
 1731:     (OsName =/= sunos)
 1732:         andalso ((length(HWAs) > 0) orelse (ct:fail(no_HWAs))),
 1733:     Addresses =
 1734:         lists:sort(
 1735:           lists:foldl(
 1736:             fun(I, Acc) ->
 1737:                     case inet_ifget(Backend, I, [addr]) of
 1738:                         {ok, [{addr,A}]} -> [A|Acc];
 1739:                         {ok, []} -> Acc
 1740:                     end
 1741:             end, [], Interfaces)),
 1742:     io:format("~w(~w) -> ifget result: "
 1743:               "~n   Addresses: "
 1744:               "~n      ~p"
 1745:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Addresses]),
 1746:     {ok, Getif} = inet_getif(Backend),
 1747:     io:format("~w(~w) -> ifget verify: "
 1748:               "~n   Addresses: "
 1749:               "~n      ~p"
 1750:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Addresses]),
 1751:     Addresses = lists:sort([A || {A,_,_} <- Getif]),
 1752:     io:format("~w(~w) -> verify address"
 1753:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend]),
 1754:     true = ip_member(Address, Addresses),
 1755:     io:format("~w(~w) -> verify loopback"
 1756:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend]),
 1757:     true = ip_member(Loopback, Addresses),
 1758:     io:format("~w(~w) -> done~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend]),
 1759:     ok.
 1760: 
 1761: %% Test long interface names do not overrun buffer.
 1762: getif_ifr_name_overflow(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1763:     case os:type() of
 1764: 	{unix,Osname} ->
 1765: 	    do_getif_ifr_name_overflow(Osname);
 1766: 	{_,_} ->
 1767: 	    {skip,"inet:ifget/2 probably not supported"}
 1768:     end.
 1769: 
 1770: do_getif_ifr_name_overflow(_) ->
 1771:     %% emulator should not crash
 1772:     {ok,[]} = inet:ifget(lists:duplicate(128, "x"), [addr]),
 1773:     ok.
 1774: 
 1775: %% Test long service names do not overrun buffer.
 1776: getservbyname_overflow(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1777:     %% emulator should not crash
 1778:     {error,einval} = inet:getservbyname(list_to_atom(lists:flatten(lists:duplicate(128, "x"))), tcp),
 1779:     ok.
 1780: 
 1781: 
 1782: %% Test inet:gifaddrs/0.
 1783: getifaddrs(Config) when is_list (Config) ->
 1784:     do_getifaddrs(default),
 1785:     do_getifaddrs(inet),
 1786:     do_getifaddrs(socket),
 1787:     getifaddrs_verify_backends().
 1788: 
 1789: do_getifaddrs(Backend) ->
 1790:     try do_getifaddrs2(Backend) of
 1791:         ok ->
 1792:             io:format("~w(~w) -> success~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend]),
 1793:             ok
 1794:     catch
 1795:         throw:{skip, Reason} ->
 1796:             io:format("~w(~w) -> skipping: "
 1797:                       "~n   ~p"
 1798:                       "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Reason]),
 1799:             ok
 1800:     end.
 1801: 
 1802: 
 1803: do_getifaddrs2(default) ->
 1804:     io:format("try 'default' getifaddrs~n", []),
 1805:     do_getifaddrs3(inet:getifaddrs());
 1806: do_getifaddrs2(Backend) ->
 1807:     Func = getifaddrs,
 1808:     Fun  = fun() -> inet:Func([{inet_backend, Backend}]) end,
 1809:     do_getifaddrs3(backend_conditional_run(Backend, Func, Fun)).
 1810:     
 1811: 
 1812: is_supported_backend(inet = _Backend) ->
 1813:     true;
 1814: is_supported_backend(socket = _Backend) ->
 1815:     is_socket_supported().
 1816: 
 1817: is_socket_supported() ->
 1818:     try socket:info() of
 1819:         #{} ->
 1820:             true
 1821:     catch
 1822:         error : notsup ->
 1823:             false;
 1824:         error : undef ->
 1825:             false
 1826:     end.
 1827: 
 1828:     
 1829: do_getifaddrs3({ok, IfAddrs}) ->
 1830:     io:format("~w(ok) -> IfAddrs: "
 1831:               "~n   ~p"
 1832:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, IfAddrs]),
 1833:     case [If || {If,Opts} <- IfAddrs, lists:keymember(hwaddr, 1, Opts)] of
 1834:         [] ->
 1835:             case os:type() of
 1836:                 {unix,sunos} -> ok;
 1837:                 OT ->
 1838:                     ct:fail({should_have_hwaddr,OT})
 1839:             end;
 1840:         [_|_] -> ok
 1841:     end,
 1842:     Addrs = ifaddrs(IfAddrs),
 1843:     io:format("Addrs: "
 1844:               "~n   ~p"
 1845:               "~n", [Addrs]),
 1846:     [check_addr(Addr) || Addr <- Addrs],
 1847:     ok.
 1848: 
 1849: check_addr(Addr)
 1850:   when tuple_size(Addr) =:= 8,
 1851:        element(1, Addr) band 16#FFC0 =:= 16#FE80 ->
 1852:     io:format("Addr: ~p link local; SKIPPED!~n", [Addr]),
 1853:     ok;
 1854: check_addr({169, 254, 118, _} = Addr) ->
 1855:     io:format("Addr: ~p reserved (not usable); SKIPPED!~n", [Addr]),
 1856:     ok;
 1857: check_addr(Addr) ->
 1858:     io:format("Addr: ~p.~n", [Addr]),
 1859:     Ping = "ping",
 1860:     Pong = "pong",
 1861:     {ok,L} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{ip,Addr},{active,false}]),
 1862:     {ok,P} = inet:port(L),
 1863:     {ok,S1} = gen_tcp:connect(Addr, P, [{active,false}]),
 1864:     {ok,S2} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 1865:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S2, Ping),
 1866:     {ok,Ping} = gen_tcp:recv(S1, length(Ping)),
 1867:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S1, Pong),
 1868:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S1),
 1869:     {ok,Pong} = gen_tcp:recv(S2, length(Pong)),
 1870:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S2),
 1871:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L).
 1872: 
 1873: ifaddrs(IfOpts) ->
 1874:     IfMap = collect_ifopts(IfOpts),
 1875:     ChkFun =
 1876:         fun Self({{_,Flags} = Key, Opts}, ok) ->
 1877:                 Broadcast = lists:member(broadcast, Flags),
 1878:                 P2P = lists:member(pointtopoint, Flags),
 1879:                 case Opts of
 1880:                     [{addr,_},{netmask,_},{broadaddr,_}|Os]
 1881:                       when Broadcast ->
 1882:                         Self({Key, Os}, ok);
 1883:                     [{addr,_},{netmask,_},{dstaddr,_}|Os]
 1884:                       when P2P ->
 1885:                         Self({Key, Os}, ok);
 1886:                     [{addr,_},{netmask,_}|Os] ->
 1887:                         Self({Key, Os}, ok);
 1888:                     [{hwaddr,_}|Os] ->
 1889:                         Self({Key, Os}, ok);
 1890:                     [] ->
 1891:                         ok
 1892:                 end
 1893:         end,
 1894:     fold_ifopts(ChkFun, ok, IfMap),
 1895:     AddrsFun =
 1896:         fun ({{_,Flags}, Opts}, Acc) ->
 1897:                 case
 1898:                     lists:member(running, Flags)
 1899:                     andalso (not lists:member(pointtopoint, Flags))
 1900:                 of
 1901:                     true ->
 1902:                         lists:reverse(
 1903:                           [Addr || {addr,Addr} <- Opts],
 1904:                           Acc);
 1905:                     false ->
 1906:                         Acc
 1907:                 end
 1908:         end,
 1909:     fold_ifopts(AddrsFun, [], IfMap).
 1910: 
 1911: collect_ifopts(IfOpts) ->
 1912:     collect_ifopts(IfOpts, #{}).
 1913: %%
 1914: collect_ifopts(IfOpts, IfMap) ->
 1915:     case IfOpts of
 1916:         [{If,[{flags,Flags}|Opts]}|IfOs] ->
 1917:             Key = {If,Flags},
 1918:             case maps:is_key(Key, IfMap) of
 1919:                 true ->
 1920:                     ct:fail({unexpected_ifopts,IfOpts,IfMap});
 1921:                 false ->
 1922:                     collect_ifopts(IfOs, IfMap, Opts, Key, [])
 1923:             end;
 1924:         [] ->
 1925:             IfMap;
 1926:         _ ->
 1927:             ct:fail({unexpected_ifopts,IfOpts,IfMap})
 1928:     end.
 1929: %%
 1930: collect_ifopts(IfOpts, IfMap, Opts, Key, R) ->
 1931:     case Opts of
 1932:         [{flags,_}|_] ->
 1933:             {If,_} = Key,
 1934:             collect_ifopts(
 1935:               [{If,Opts}|IfOpts], maps:put(Key, lists:reverse(R), IfMap));
 1936:         [OptVal|Os] ->
 1937:             collect_ifopts(IfOpts, IfMap, Os, Key, [OptVal|R]);
 1938:         [] ->
 1939:             collect_ifopts(IfOpts, maps:put(Key, lists:reverse(R), IfMap))
 1940:     end.
 1941: 
 1942: fold_ifopts(Fun, Acc, IfMap) ->
 1943:     fold_ifopts(Fun, Acc, IfMap, maps:keys(IfMap)).
 1944: %%
 1945: fold_ifopts(Fun, Acc, IfMap, Keys) ->
 1946:     case Keys of
 1947:         [Key|Ks] ->
 1948:             Opts = maps:get(Key, IfMap),
 1949:             fold_ifopts(Fun, Fun({Key,Opts}, Acc), IfMap, Ks);
 1950:         [] ->
 1951:             Acc
 1952:     end.
 1953: 
 1954: 
 1955: getifaddrs_verify_backends() ->
 1956:     io:format("maybe attempt verify backends~n", []),
 1957:     try is_supported_backend(inet) of
 1958:         true ->
 1959:             try is_supported_backend(socket) of
 1960:                 true ->
 1961:                     getifaddrs_verify_backends(
 1962:                       inet:getifaddrs([{inet_backend, inet}]),
 1963:                       inet:getifaddrs([{inet_backend, socket}]));
 1964:                 false ->
 1965:                     io:format("'socket' backend not supported: skip~n", [])
 1966:             catch
 1967:                 SC:SE:SS ->
 1968:                     io:format("skipping ~p: "
 1969:                               "~n   (Error) Class: ~p"
 1970:                               "~n   Error:         ~p"
 1971:                               "~n   Stack:         ~p"
 1972:                               "~n", [socket, SC, SE, SS]),
 1973:                     ok
 1974:             end;
 1975:         false ->
 1976:             io:format("'inet' backend not supported: skip~n", [])
 1977:     catch
 1978:         IC:IE:IS ->
 1979:             io:format("skipping ~p: "
 1980:                       "~n   (Error) Class: ~p"
 1981:                       "~n   Error:         ~p"
 1982:                       "~n   Stack:         ~p"
 1983:                       "~n", [inet, IC, IE, IS]),
 1984:             ok
 1985:     end.
 1986: 
 1987: getifaddrs_verify_backends({ok, IfAddrs},
 1988:                            {ok, IfAddrs}) ->
 1989:     io:format("IfAddrs are equal: "
 1990:               "~n   ~p"
 1991:               "~n", [IfAddrs]),
 1992:     ok;
 1993: getifaddrs_verify_backends({ok, IfAddrs_INET},
 1994:                            {ok, IfAddrs_SOCKET}) ->
 1995:     io:format("IfAddrs are not *identical* - check what differs: "
 1996:               "~n   INET:"
 1997:               "~n      ~p"
 1998:               "~n   SOCKET:"
 1999:               "~n      ~p"
 2000:               "~n   INET -- SOCKET: "
 2001:               "~n      ~p"
 2002:               "~n   SOCKET -- INET: "
 2003:               "~n      ~p"
 2004:               "~n", [IfAddrs_INET, IfAddrs_SOCKET,
 2005:                      IfAddrs_INET -- IfAddrs_SOCKET,
 2006:                      IfAddrs_SOCKET -- IfAddrs_INET]),
 2007:     getifaddrs_verify_backends2(IfAddrs_INET, IfAddrs_SOCKET).
 2008: 
 2009: getifaddrs_verify_backends2(INET, SOCKET) ->
 2010:     getifaddrs_verify_backends3(lists:keysort(1, INET),
 2011:                                 lists:keysort(1, SOCKET)).
 2012: 
 2013: getifaddrs_verify_backends3([] = _INET, [] = _SOCKET) ->
 2014:     ok;
 2015: getifaddrs_verify_backends3([] = _INET, SOCKET) ->
 2016:     io:format("'socket' backend contains extra interfaces: "
 2017:               "~n   ~p"
 2018:               "~n", [SOCKET]),
 2019:     ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal);
 2020: getifaddrs_verify_backends3(INET, [] = _SOCKET) ->
 2021:     io:format("'inet' backend contains extra interfaces: "
 2022:               "~n   ~p"
 2023:               "~n", [INET]),
 2024:     ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal);
 2025: getifaddrs_verify_backends3([{IF, INFO}|INET],
 2026:                             [{IF, INFO}|SOCKET]) ->
 2027:     io:format("backend(s) identical for ~p~n", [IF]),
 2028:     getifaddrs_verify_backends3(INET, SOCKET);
 2029: getifaddrs_verify_backends3([{IF, I_INFO}|INET],
 2030:                             [{IF, S_INFO}|SOCKET]) ->
 2031:     io:format("backend(s) not *identical* for ~p~n", [IF]),
 2032:     getifaddrs_verify_backend(IF, I_INFO, S_INFO),
 2033:     getifaddrs_verify_backends3(INET, SOCKET);
 2034: getifaddrs_verify_backends3([{I_IF, _}|_], [{S_IF, _}|_]) ->
 2035:     io:format("not equal interfaces"
 2036:               "~n   ~p"
 2037:               "~n   ~p"
 2038:               "~n", [I_IF, S_IF]),
 2039:     ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal).
 2040: 
 2041: 
 2042: %% On windows the info may be in different order
 2043: %% (inet and net versions) because the information
 2044: %% comes from several sources. And the processing
 2045: %% is different on inet and net.
 2046: %% The info always starts with 'flags' and ends with
 2047: %% 'hwaddr'. So deal with those two first and the rest
 2048: %% can compared after.
 2049: 
 2050: getifaddrs_verify_backend(IF, I_INFO, S_INFO) ->
 2051:     {I_Rest1, S_Rest1} =
 2052:         case {I_INFO, S_INFO} of
 2053:             {[{flags, I_FLAGS}|IR1], [{flags, S_FLAGS}|SR1]} ->
 2054:                 case {I_FLAGS -- S_FLAGS, S_FLAGS -- I_FLAGS} of
 2055:                     {[], []} ->
 2056:                         io:format("flags for ~p *are* equal~n", [IF]),
 2057:                         {IR1, SR1};
 2058:                     {[], [multicast]} ->
 2059:                         io:format("flags for ~p are *not* equal - "
 2060:                                   "extra flag 'multicast': "
 2061:                                   "~n   INET:   ~p"
 2062:                                   "~n   SOCKET: ~p"
 2063:                                   "~n", [IF, I_FLAGS, S_FLAGS]),
 2064:                         case lists:member(loopback, I_FLAGS) of
 2065:                             true ->
 2066:                                 %% The net module getifaddrs contains
 2067:                                 %% some more flags...
 2068:                                 %% Happens on windows
 2069:                                 io:format("flags for ~p *acceptably* "
 2070:                                           "different~n", [IF]),
 2071:                                 {IR1, SR1};
 2072:                             _ ->
 2073:                                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal)
 2074:                         end;
 2075:                     {[], [running]} ->
 2076:                         io:format("flags for ~p are *not* equal - "
 2077:                                   "extra flag 'running': "
 2078:                                   "~n   INET:   ~p"
 2079:                                   "~n   SOCKET: ~p"
 2080:                                   "~n", [IF, I_FLAGS, S_FLAGS]),
 2081:                         case lists:member(up, I_FLAGS) of
 2082:                             true ->
 2083:                                 %% The net module getifaddrs contains
 2084:                                 %% some more flags...
 2085:                                 %% Happens on windows
 2086:                                 io:format("flags for ~p *acceptably* "
 2087:                                           "different~n", [IF]),
 2088:                                 {IR1, SR1};
 2089:                             _ ->
 2090:                                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal)
 2091:                         end;
 2092:                     {IRem, SRem} ->
 2093:                         io:format("flags for ~p are *not* equal - check flags: "
 2094:                                   "~n   INET:   ~p"
 2095:                                   "~n   SOCKET: ~p"
 2096:                                   "~n   INET -- SOCKET: ~p"
 2097:                                   "~n   SOCKET -- INET: ~p"
 2098:                                   "~n", [IF, I_FLAGS, S_FLAGS, IRem, SRem]),
 2099:                         ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal)
 2100:                 end;
 2101:             _ ->
 2102:                 io:format("flags for ~p missing for one or both backends: "
 2103:                           "~n   INET:   ~p"
 2104:                           "~n   SOCKET: ~p"
 2105:                           "~n", [IF, I_INFO, S_INFO]),
 2106:                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal)
 2107:         end,
 2108:     {I_Rest2, S_Rest2} =
 2109:         case {lists:reverse(I_Rest1), lists:reverse(S_Rest1)} of
 2110:             {[{hwaddr, HWADDR}|IR2], [{hwaddr, HWADDR}|SR2]} ->
 2111:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p *is* equal~n", [IF]),
 2112:                 {lists:reverse(IR2), lists:reverse(SR2)};
 2113:             {[{hwaddr, I_HWADDR}|_IR2], [{hwaddr, S_HWADDR}|_SR2]} ->
 2114:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p *not* equal:"
 2115:                           "~n   INET:   ~p"
 2116:                           "~n   SOCKET: ~p"
 2117:                           "~n", [IF, I_HWADDR, S_HWADDR]),
 2118:                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal);
 2119:             {IR2, [{hwaddr, HWADDR}|SR2]} ->
 2120:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p only for socket - accept: "
 2121:                           "~n   ~p"
 2122:                           "~n", [IF, HWADDR]),
 2123:                 {lists:reverse(IR2), lists:reverse(SR2)};
 2124:             {[{hwaddr, HWADDR}|_IR2], _SR2} ->
 2125:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p only for inet - fail: "
 2126:                           "~n   ~p"
 2127:                           "~n", [IF, HWADDR]),
 2128:                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal);
 2129:             _ ->
 2130:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p missing for both backends - accept~n",
 2131:                           [IF]),
 2132:                 {I_Rest1, S_Rest1}
 2133:         end,
 2134:     case {I_Rest2 -- S_Rest2, S_Rest2 -- I_Rest2} of
 2135:         {[], []} ->
 2136:             io:format("remaining info for ~p is equal~n", [IF]),
 2137:             ok;
 2138:         {I_Diff, S_Diff} ->
 2139:             io:format("remaining info for ~p not equal: "
 2140:                       "~n   INET:           ~p"
 2141:                       "~n   SOCKET:         ~p"
 2142:                       "~n   INET -- SOCKET: ~p"
 2143:                       "~n   SOCKET -- INET: ~p"
 2144:                       "~n", [IF, I_Rest2, S_Rest2, I_Diff, S_Diff]),
 2145:             %% Check if its a link local address, then ignore...
 2146:             %% This is "a bit" loosey-goosey...
 2147:             case lists:keysearch(addr, 1, S_Rest2) of
 2148:                 {value, {addr, {169, 254, _, _}}} ->
 2149:                     io:format("link local address for ~p - accept~n", [IF]),
 2150:                     ok;
 2151:                 _ ->
 2152:                     ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal)
 2153:             end
 2154:     end.
 2155: 
 2156: 
 2157: %% Works just like lists:member/2, except that any {127,_,_,_} tuple
 2158: %% matches any other {127,_,_,_}. We do this to handle Linux systems
 2159: %% that use (for instance) 127.0.1.1 as the IP address for the hostname.
 2160: 
 2161: ip_member({127,_,_,_}, [{127,_,_,_}|_]) -> true;
 2162: ip_member(K, [K|_]) -> true;
 2163: ip_member(K, [_|T]) -> ip_member(K, T);
 2164: ip_member(_, []) -> false.
 2165: 
 2166: %% Case fold to upper case according to RFC 4343
 2167: %%
 2168: toupper([C|Cs]) when is_integer(C) ->
 2169:     if  $a =< C, C =< $z ->
 2170: 	    [(C - $a + $A)|toupper(Cs)];
 2171: 	true ->
 2172: 	    [C|toupper(Cs)]
 2173:     end;
 2174: toupper([]) ->
 2175:     [].
 2176: 
 2177: 
 2178: simple_netns(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2179:     {ok,U} = gen_udp:open(0),
 2180:     case inet:setopts(U, [{netns,""}]) of
 2181: 	ok ->
 2182: 	    jog_netns_opt(U),
 2183: 	    ok = gen_udp:close(U),
 2184: 	    %%
 2185: 	    {ok,L} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
 2186: 	    jog_netns_opt(L),
 2187: 	    ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 2188: 	    %%
 2189: 	    case gen_sctp:open() of
 2190: 		{ok,S} ->
 2191: 		    jog_netns_opt(S),
 2192: 		    ok = gen_sctp:close(S);
 2193: 		{error,eprotonosupport} ->
 2194: 		    ok
 2195: 	    end;
 2196: 	{error,einval} ->
 2197: 	    {skip,"setns() not supported"}
 2198:     end.
 2199: 
 2200: jog_netns_opt(S) ->
 2201:     %% This is just jogging the option mechanics
 2202:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{netns,""}]),
 2203:     {ok,[{netns,""}]} = inet:getopts(S, [netns]),
 2204:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{netns,"/proc/self/ns/net"}]),
 2205:     {ok,[{netns,"/proc/self/ns/net"}]} = inet:getopts(S, [netns]),
 2206:     ok.
 2207: 
 2208: 
 2209: %% Smoke test netns support.
 2210: simple_netns_open(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2211:     %% Note: {error,enoent} will be returned if the run-time executable
 2212:     %%       has support for netns, but /proc/self/ns/net is missing.
 2213:     case gen_udp:open(0, [binary,{netns,"/"},inet]) of
 2214: 	{ok,U} ->
 2215: 	    ok = gen_udp:close(U);
 2216: 	{error,E1} when E1 =:= einval; E1 =:= eperm; E1 =:= enoent ->
 2217: 	    ok
 2218:     end,
 2219:     case gen_tcp:listen(0, [binary,{netns,"/"},inet]) of
 2220: 	{ok,T} ->
 2221: 	    ok = gen_tcp:close(T);
 2222: 	{error,E2} when E2 =:= einval; E2 =:= eperm; E2 =:= enoent ->
 2223: 	    ok
 2224:     end,
 2225:     try gen_sctp:open(0, [binary,{netns,"/"},inet]) of
 2226: 	{ok,S} ->
 2227: 	    ok = gen_sctp:close(S);
 2228: 	{error,E3}
 2229: 	  when E3 =:= einval; E3 =:= eperm;
 2230: 	       E3 =:= enoent; E3 =:= eprotonosupport ->
 2231: 	    ok
 2232:     catch
 2233: 	error:badarg ->
 2234: 	    %% Some older platforms does not allow netns for sctp
 2235: 	    ok
 2236:     end.
 2237: 
 2238: 
 2239: %% Manual test to be run outside test_server in an emulator
 2240: %% started by root, in a machine with setns() support...
 2241: test_netns() ->
 2242:     DefaultIF = v1,
 2243:     DefaultIP = {192,168,1,17},
 2244:     Namespace = "test",
 2245:     NamespaceIF = v2,
 2246:     NamespaceIP = {192,168,1,18},
 2247:     %%
 2248:     DefaultIPString = inet_parse:ntoa(DefaultIP),
 2249:     NamespaceIPString = inet_parse:ntoa(NamespaceIP),
 2250:     cmd("ip netns add ~s",
 2251: 	[Namespace]),
 2252:     cmd("ip link add name ~w type veth peer name ~w netns ~s",
 2253:         [DefaultIF,NamespaceIF,Namespace]),
 2254:     cmd("ip netns exec ~s ip addr add ~s/30 dev ~w",
 2255: 	[Namespace,NamespaceIPString,NamespaceIF]),
 2256:     cmd("ip netns exec ~s ip link set ~w up",
 2257: 	[Namespace,NamespaceIF]),
 2258:     cmd("ip addr add ~s/30 dev ~w",
 2259: 	[DefaultIPString,DefaultIF]),
 2260:     cmd("ip link set ~w up",
 2261: 	[DefaultIF]),
 2262:     try test_netns(
 2263: 	  {DefaultIF,DefaultIP},
 2264: 	  filename:join("/var/run/netns/", Namespace),
 2265: 	  {NamespaceIF,NamespaceIP}) of
 2266: 	Result ->
 2267: 	    io:put_chars(["#### Test done",io_lib:nl()]),
 2268: 	    Result
 2269:     after
 2270: 	cmd("ip link delete ~w type veth",
 2271: 	    [DefaultIF]),
 2272: 	cmd("ip netns delete ~s",
 2273: 	    [Namespace])
 2274:     end.
 2275: 
 2276: test_netns({DefaultIF,DefaultIP}, Namespace, {NamespaceIF,NamespaceIP}) ->
 2277:     {ok,ListenSocket} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 2278:     {ok,[{addr,DefaultIP}]} = inet:ifget(ListenSocket, DefaultIF, [addr]),
 2279:     {ok,ListenPort} = inet:port(ListenSocket),
 2280:     {ok,ConnectSocket} =
 2281: 	gen_tcp:connect(
 2282: 	  DefaultIP, ListenPort, [{active,false},{netns,Namespace}], 3000),
 2283:     {ok,[{addr,NamespaceIP}]} = inet:ifget(ConnectSocket, NamespaceIF, [addr]),
 2284:     {ok,ConnectPort} = inet:port(ConnectSocket),
 2285:     {ok,AcceptSocket} = gen_tcp:accept(ListenSocket, 0),
 2286:     {ok,AcceptPort} = inet:port(AcceptSocket),
 2287:     {ok,{NamespaceIP,ConnectPort}} = inet:peername(AcceptSocket),
 2288:     {ok,{DefaultIP,AcceptPort}} = inet:peername(ConnectSocket),
 2289:     ok = gen_tcp:send(ConnectSocket, "data"),
 2290:     ok = gen_tcp:close(ConnectSocket),
 2291:     {ok,"data"} = gen_tcp:recv(AcceptSocket, 4, 1000),
 2292:     {error,closed} = gen_tcp:recv(AcceptSocket, 1, 1000),
 2293:     ok = gen_tcp:close(AcceptSocket),
 2294:     ok = gen_tcp:close(ListenSocket).
 2295: 
 2296: cmd(Cmd, Args) ->
 2297:     cmd(io_lib:format(Cmd, Args)).
 2298: %%
 2299: cmd(CmdString) ->
 2300:     io:put_chars(["# ",CmdString,io_lib:nl()]),
 2301:     io:put_chars([os:cmd(CmdString++" ; echo '  =>' $?")]),
 2302:     ok.
 2303: 
 2304: -define(CAP_NET_RAW, 13).        %% from /usr/include/linux/capability.h
 2305: 
 2306: can_bind_to_device({unix, linux}, {Major, _, _})
 2307:   when Major > 2 ->
 2308:     Status = os:cmd("cat /proc/self/status | grep CapEff"),
 2309:     [_, CapEffStr] = string:tokens(Status, [$\n, $\t]),
 2310:     CapEff = list_to_integer(CapEffStr, 16),
 2311:     if CapEff band (1 bsl ?CAP_NET_RAW) =/= 0 ->
 2312:             ok;
 2313:        true ->
 2314:             {skip,"insufficient capabilities, CAP_NET_RAW not granted"}
 2315:     end;
 2316: can_bind_to_device(_OS, _Version) ->
 2317:     {skip,"socket option bind_to_device not supported on this OS or version"}.
 2318: 
 2319: simple_bind_to_device(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2320:     case can_bind_to_device(os:type(), os:version()) of
 2321:         ok ->
 2322:             {ok,U} = gen_udp:open(0),
 2323:             jog_bind_to_device_opt(U),
 2324:             ok = gen_udp:close(U),
 2325:             %%
 2326:             {ok,L} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
 2327:             jog_bind_to_device_opt(L),
 2328:             ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 2329:             %%
 2330:             case gen_sctp:open() of
 2331:                 {ok,S} ->
 2332:                     jog_bind_to_device_opt(S),
 2333:                     ok = gen_sctp:close(S);
 2334:                 {error,eprotonosupport} ->
 2335:                     ok
 2336:             end;
 2337:         Other ->
 2338:             Other
 2339:     end.
 2340: 
 2341: %% Smoke test bind_to_device support.
 2342: simple_bind_to_device_open(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2343:     case can_bind_to_device(os:type(), os:version()) of
 2344:         ok ->
 2345:             {ok,U} = gen_udp:open(0, [binary,{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>},inet]),
 2346:             ok = gen_udp:close(U),
 2347:             {ok,T} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [binary,{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>},inet]),
 2348:             ok = gen_tcp:close(T),
 2349: 
 2350:             case gen_sctp:open(0, [binary,{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>},inet]) of
 2351:                 {ok,S} ->
 2352:                     ok = gen_sctp:close(S);
 2353:                 {error,eprotonosupport} ->
 2354:                     ok
 2355:             end;
 2356:         Other ->
 2357:             Other
 2358:     end.
 2359: 
 2360: jog_bind_to_device_opt(S) ->
 2361:     %% This is just jogging the option mechanics
 2362:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{bind_to_device,<<>>}]),
 2363:     {ok,[{bind_to_device,<<>>}]} = inet:getopts(S, [bind_to_device]),
 2364:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>}]),
 2365:     {ok,[{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>}]} = inet:getopts(S, [bind_to_device]),
 2366:     ok.
 2367: 
 2368: add_del_host(_Config) ->
 2369:     Name = "foo.com",
 2370:     Alias = "bar.org",
 2371:     Ip = {69,89,31,226},
 2372:     HostEnt = #hostent{
 2373:         h_name = Name,
 2374:         h_aliases = [Alias],
 2375:         h_addrtype = inet,
 2376:         h_length = 4,
 2377:         h_addr_list = [Ip]
 2378:     },
 2379:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet),
 2380:     ok = inet_db:add_host(Ip, [Name, Alias]),
 2381:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet),
 2382:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Alias, inet),
 2383:     ok = inet_db:del_host(Ip),
 2384:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet),
 2385:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Alias, inet),
 2386:     ok = inet_db:add_host(Ip, [Name, Alias]),
 2387:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet).
 2388: 
 2389: add_del_host_v6(_Config) ->
 2390:     Name = "foo.com",
 2391:     Alias = "bar.org",
 2392:     Ip = {32,1,219,8,10,11,18,240},
 2393:     HostEnt = #hostent{
 2394:         h_name = Name,
 2395:         h_aliases = [Alias],
 2396:         h_addrtype = inet6,
 2397:         h_length = 16,
 2398:         h_addr_list = [Ip]
 2399:     },
 2400:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet6),
 2401:     ok = inet_db:add_host(Ip, [Name, Alias]),
 2402:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet6),
 2403:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Alias, inet6),
 2404:     ok = inet_db:del_host(Ip),
 2405:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet6),
 2406:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Alias, inet6),
 2407:     ok = inet_db:add_host(Ip, [Name, Alias]),
 2408:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet6).
 2409: 
 2410: 
 2411: 
 2412: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2413: 
 2414: %%% This is a supremely simple test case.
 2415: %%% It basically just tests that the function (inet:socknames/1,2)
 2416: %%% returns with the expected result (a list of addresses, which in
 2417: %%% the case of tcp and udp should be exactly one address long).
 2418: 
 2419: socknames_sctp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2420:     %%% ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_socknames_sctp(Config) end).
 2421:     {skip, not_implemented_yet}.
 2422: 
 2423: 
 2424: socknames_tcp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2425:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 2426:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 2427:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 2428:                             Addr;
 2429:                         {error, Reason} ->
 2430:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 2431:                     end
 2432:            end,
 2433:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socknames_tcp0(Config, Addr) end,
 2434:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 2435:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2436: 
 2437: do_socknames_tcp0(_Config, Addr) ->
 2438:     %% Begin with a the plain old boring (= port) socket(s)
 2439:     ?P("Test socknames for 'old' socket (=port)"),
 2440:     do_socknames_tcp1([], Addr),
 2441: 
 2442:     %% And *maybe* also check the 'new' shiny socket sockets
 2443:     try socket:info() of
 2444:         #{} ->
 2445:             ?P("Test socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)"),
 2446:             do_socknames_tcp1([{inet_backend, socket}], Addr)
 2447:     catch
 2448:         error:notsup ->
 2449:             ?P("Skip test of socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)"),
 2450:             ok;
 2451:         error:undef:ST ->
 2452:             case ST of
 2453:                 [{prim_socket,info,[],_}|_] ->
 2454:                     ?P("Skip test of socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)")
 2455:             end
 2456:     end.
 2457: 
 2458: 
 2459: do_socknames_tcp1(Conf, Addr) ->
 2460:     %% For socket on windows, we require binding...
 2461:     ?P("try to bind to ~p", [Addr]),
 2462:     BaseOpts = [{ip, Addr}],
 2463: 
 2464:     ?P("try create listen socket"),
 2465:     {ok, S1} = gen_tcp:listen(0, Conf ++ BaseOpts),
 2466:     ?P("try get socknames for (listen) socket: "
 2467:        "~n      ~p", [S1]),
 2468:     PortNumber1 = case inet:socknames(S1) of
 2469: 		      {ok, [{_Addr1, PortNo1}]} ->
 2470: 			  PortNo1;
 2471: 		      {ok, Addrs1} ->
 2472:                           ?P("failed socknames: unexpected number of addresses"
 2473:                              "~n      ~p", [Addrs1]),
 2474: 			  exit({unexpected_addrs_length, length(Addrs1)});
 2475: 		      {error, Reason1} ->
 2476:                           ?P("failed socknames: error"
 2477:                              "~n      ~p", [Reason1]),
 2478: 			  exit({skip, {listen_socket, Reason1}})
 2479: 		  end,
 2480:     ?P("try connect to listen socket on port ~p", [PortNumber1]),
 2481:     {ok, S2} = gen_tcp:connect(Addr, PortNumber1, Conf ++ BaseOpts),
 2482:     ?P("try get socknames for (connected) socket: "
 2483:        "~n      ~p", [S2]),
 2484:     case inet:socknames(S2) of
 2485: 	{ok, [_Addr2]} ->
 2486: 	    ok;
 2487: 	{ok, Addrs2} ->
 2488:             ?P("failed socknames: unexpected number of addresses"
 2489:                "~n      ~p", [Addrs2]),
 2490: 	    exit({unexpected_addrs_length, length(Addrs2)});
 2491: 	{error, Reason2} ->
 2492:             ?P("failed socknames: error"
 2493:                "~n      ~p", [Reason2]),
 2494: 	    exit({skip, {connected_socket, Reason2}})
 2495:     end,
 2496:     ?P("try accept connection"),
 2497:     {ok, S3} = gen_tcp:accept(S1),
 2498:     ?P("try get socknames for (accepted) socket: "
 2499:        "~n      ~p", [S3]),
 2500:     case inet:socknames(S3) of
 2501: 	{ok, [_Addr3]} ->
 2502: 	    ok;
 2503: 	{ok, Addrs3} ->
 2504:             ?P("failed socknames: unexpected number of addresses"
 2505:                "~n      ~p", [Addrs3]),
 2506: 	    exit({unexpected_addrs_length, length(Addrs3)});
 2507: 	{error, Reason3} ->
 2508:             ?P("failed socknames: error"
 2509:                "~n      ~p", [Reason3]),
 2510: 	    exit({skip, {accepted_socket, Reason3}})
 2511:     end,
 2512:     ?P("close socket(s)"),
 2513:     (catch gen_tcp:close(S3)),
 2514:     (catch gen_tcp:close(S2)),
 2515:     (catch gen_tcp:close(S1)),
 2516:     ?P("done"),
 2517:     ok.
 2518: 
 2519: 
 2520: socknames_udp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2521:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 2522:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 2523:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 2524:                             Addr;
 2525:                         {error, Reason} ->
 2526:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 2527:                     end
 2528:            end,
 2529:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socknames_udp0(Config, Addr) end,
 2530:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 2531:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2532: 
 2533: do_socknames_udp0(_Config, Addr) ->
 2534:     %% Begin with a the plain old boring (= port) socket(s)
 2535:     ?P("Test socknames for 'old' socket (=port)"),
 2536:     do_socknames_udp1([], Addr),
 2537: 
 2538:     %% And *maybe* also check the 'new' shiny socket sockets
 2539:     try socket:info() of
 2540:         #{} ->
 2541:             ?P("Test socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)"),
 2542:             do_socknames_udp1([{inet_backend, socket}], Addr)
 2543:     catch
 2544:         error : notsup ->
 2545:             ?P("Skip test of socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)"),
 2546:             ok;
 2547:         error:undef:ST ->
 2548:             case ST of
 2549:                 [{prim_socket,info,[],_}|_] ->
 2550:                     ?P("Skip test of socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)")
 2551:             end
 2552:     end.
 2553: 
 2554: 
 2555: do_socknames_udp1(Conf, Addr) ->
 2556:     %% For socket on windows, we require binding...
 2557:     ?P("try to bind to ~p", [Addr]),
 2558:     BaseOpts = [{ip, Addr}],
 2559: 
 2560:     ?P("try create socket"),
 2561:     {ok, S1} = gen_udp:open(0, Conf ++ BaseOpts),
 2562:     ?P("try get socknames for socket: "
 2563:        "~n      ~p", [S1]),
 2564:     case inet:socknames(S1) of
 2565:         {ok, [_Addr1]} ->
 2566:             ok;
 2567:         {ok, Addrs1} ->
 2568:             ?P("failed socknames: unexpected number of addresses"
 2569:                "~n      ~p", [Addrs1]),
 2570:             exit({unexpected_addrs_length, length(Addrs1)});
 2571:         {error, Reason1} ->
 2572:             ?P("failed socknames: error"
 2573:                "~n      ~p", [Reason1]),
 2574:             exit({skip, {listen_socket, Reason1}})
 2575:     end,
 2576:     ?P("enable debug"),
 2577:     inet:setopts(S1, [{debug, true}]),
 2578:     ?P("close socket"),
 2579:     (catch gen_udp:close(S1)),
 2580:     ?P("done"),
 2581:     ok.
 2582: 
 2583: 
 2584: 
 2585: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2586: 
 2587: links() ->
 2588:     pi(links).
 2589: 
 2590: monitors() ->
 2591:     pi(monitors).
 2592: 
 2593: pi(Item) ->
 2594:     {Item, Val} = process_info(self(), Item),
 2595:     Val.
 2596:     
 2597:
